qas.question: What century did terms referencing Iran begin to be recorded?
What inscription referenced the term Aryan to Iranians?
What other term in the 3rd Century besides Aryan also refer to Iran?
What is attested as a self-identifier in Iranian languages?

context: The term Iran derives directly from Middle Persian <a3_0>Ērān<a3_0/>, first attested in a <a0_0>3rd-century<a0_0/> inscription at Rustam Relief, with the accompanying <a1_0>Parthian<a1_0/> inscription using the term Aryān, in reference to Iranians. The Middle Iranian ērān and aryān are oblique plural forms of gentilic ēr- (Middle Persian) and ary- (Parthian), both deriving from Proto-Iranian *arya- (meaning "Aryan," i.e., "of the Iranians"), argued to descend from Proto-Indo-European <a2_0>*ar-yo-<a2_0/>, meaning "skillful assembler." In Iranian languages, <a4_0>the gentilic<a4_0/> is attested as a self-identifier included in ancient inscriptions and the literature of Avesta,[a] and remains also in other Iranian ethnic names such as Alans (Ossetic: Ир – Ir) and Iron (Ossetic: Ирон – Iron).
